subject: problem with assert equals
msgSnippet: I am making an assertion in a test script and it is throwing an error.  I know that the arguments that I am passing into the assertion are valid String
messageBody:
I am making an assertion in a test script and it is throwing an error. I know that the arguments that I am passing into the assertion are valid String objects.

Here's the error:

Caused an ERROR
junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;)V
at mil.usaf.rad.course.tests.CourseFactoryTest.testCreateSection(Unknown Source)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
at org.netbeans.core.execution.RunClassThread.run(RunClassThread.java:119)


Here's the code:

public void testCreateSection() throws Exception {
Section section = CourseFactory.newSection();
section.setCourse(course);
section.setName("section");
section.setAccountRequired(false);
section.save();

Section section2 = CourseFactory.getSection(section.getSectionID());

//System.err.println("section2 name: " + section2.getName());
//System.err.println("section name: " + section.getName());
>> assertEquals(section.getName(), section2.getName()); // throws the error
assertEquals(section.getCourse(), section2.getCourse()); // if I comment the line above, then this line will run just fine.
assertEquals(section.getAccountRequired(), section2.getAccountRequired());
}


If I uncomment the System.err lines then I see that both of these objects have the name "section" which is what I want, but for some reason the call to assertEquals will throw the error above.


Does anyone know what would or could be causing this?



Thanks,

Dave
